intro: Dondia richii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters and thrives in humid, well-drained soil. It is popular as a houseplant due to its attractive foliage and ease of care. Dondia richii prefers indirect light and moderate temperatures, making it suitable for indoor cultivation.
